page.title: 03THE WIGAN PIER COMPLEX #2
page.content: The{Heritage Centre}at Wigan Pier is a kind of museum, but it is also much more because it has live exhibits. It is intended to show what everyday life was like in Wigan around 1900. Human exhibits show what a Pit Brow Lass or a Mill Hand did for a living. Other people featured include a collier's wife, school teacher, music hall comedian, clogger and a basket weaver. Some shops and streets are recreated and the sweet firm of William Santus, famous for{Uncle Joe's Mint Balls,}is also shown. There is a souvenier shop, a tourist information centre and some private offices all within the nicely restored warehouses the oldest of which dates back to 1777. The final touches to the renovation are found on{The Orwell,}a pub named after the author of{The Road to Wigan {Pier.
